I began a crawl with 10 or so seed items.
I am using a surt_source_file for=
 Decision: ACCEPT
and another surt_source_file for Decision: REJECT

For bo=
th SurtPrefixDecideRules the following are set 
seeds--as-surt-prefixes: FA=
LSE
also-check-via: FALSE
rebuild-on-reconfig: TRUE

I realized after the c=
rawl had initiated by using the view the seed
report that a couple of the s=
eed items were being excluded by the
'REJECT' SurtPrefixDecideRule - I had =
mistakenly entered in the same
domain as a couple of the seed items.

I pau=
sed the job, edited and removed the entries in the 'REJECT'
SurtPrefixDecid=
eRule surt-source-file, clicked 'Finished' on the job
edit page, and resume=
d the crawl. I took another look at the seed
report through the job page an=
d the site still reports -5000. I forced
generation of the crawl reports an=
d viewed the seed-reports.txt file
and the sites still report -5000.

Is th=
ere something I am doing wrong?

Thanks for any help,
Mike
